column1: The test measures levels of four pregnancy hormones: - Alpha-fetoprotein (AFP) -- a protein produced by the baby - Human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG) -- a hormone produced in the placenta - Unconjugated estriol (uE3) -- a form of the hormone estrogen produced in the fetus and the placenta - Inhibin A -- a hormone released by the placenta If the test does not measure levels of inhibin A, it is called the triple screen test.
